sentences.sentence: Debating when Biden and Feinstein should retire ᅳ and when you should.Listen to and follow 'Matter of Opinion'Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Amazon MusicThe median age of senators is 65.
We're heading into a presidential contest that might find candidates who are 78 and 82 facing off on Election Day.
Our government, people have argued, is a gerontocracy.
But is that a bad thing?
Should our older leaders take a back seat?

And for all of us, how do you know when it's the right time to retire?Background reading·“Inside the Complicated Reality of Being America's Oldest President” (The New York Times)·“Feinstein, Back in the Senate, Relies Heavily on Staff to Function” (The New York Times)“Inside the Complicated Reality of Being America's Oldest President” (The New York Times)“Feinstein, Back in the Senate, Relies Heavily on Staff to Function” (The New York Times)Thoughts?
Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.comor leave us a voice mail message at (212) 556-7440.

We may use excerpts from your message in a future episode.By leaving us a message, you are agreeing to be governed by ourreader submission termsand agreeing that we may use and allow others to use your name, voice and message.Follow our hosts on Twitter: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT), Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT) and Lydia Polgreen (@lpolgreen).“Matter of Opinion” was produced this week by Phoebe Lett, Sophia Alvarez Boyd and Derek Arthur.
It was edited by Stephanie Joyce.
Original music by Isaac Jones, Efim Shapiro, Carole Sabouraud, Sonia Herrero and Pat McCusker.
Our fact-checking team is Kate Sinclair, Mary Marge Locker and Michelle Harris.
Audience strategy by Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski.
Our executive producer is Annie-Rose Strasser.PHOTO: (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by The New York Times; pool photo FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: Debating when Biden and Feinstein should retire — and when you should.Listen to and follow ‘Matter of Opinion’Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Amazon MusicThe median age of senators is 65. We’re heading into a presidential contest that might find candidates who are 78 and 82 facing off on Election Day. Our government, people have argued, is a gerontocracy. But is that a bad thing? Should our older leaders take a back seat? And for all of us, how do you know when it’s the right time to retire?Background reading•“Inside the Complicated Reality of Being America’s Oldest President” (The New York Times)•“Feinstein, Back in the Senate, Relies Heavily on Staff to Function” (The New York Times)“Inside the Complicated Reality of Being America’s Oldest President” (The New York Times)“Feinstein, Back in the Senate, Relies Heavily on Staff to Function” (The New York Times)Thoughts? Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.comor leave us a voice mail message at (212) 556-7440. We may use excerpts from your message in a future episode.By leaving us a message, you are agreeing to be governed by ourreader submission termsand agreeing that we may use and allow others to use your name, voice and message.Follow our hosts on Twitter: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT), Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT) and Lydia Polgreen (@lpolgreen).“Matter of Opinion” was produced this week by Phoebe Lett, Sophia Alvarez Boyd and Derek Arthur. It was edited by Stephanie Joyce. Mixing by Isaac Jones. Original music by Isaac Jones, Efim Shapiro, Carole Sabouraud, Sonia Herrero and Pat McCusker. Our fact-checking team is Kate Sinclair, Mary Marge Locker and Michelle Harris. Audience strategy by Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski. Our executive producer is Annie-Rose Strasser.PHOTO:  (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by The New York Times; pool photo FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)
